alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Canyon; Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 7:01PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL BIG HORN AND NORTHWESTERN SHERIDAN COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM MDT... At 700 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Horseshoe Bend, or 23 miles northeast of Lovell, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail and wind gusts of 40 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Big Horn and northwestern Sheridan Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Canyon; Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southern Big Horn
